page.title: 08 Sevenoaks School
page.content: Sevenoaks School is a Public School for girls and boys between the ages of 11 to 18. The fees are 4743 pounds for boarders and 2853 pounds for day-pupils. The school owns 90 acres of land. The Headmaster is Mr.Richard Barker and there are 140 members of staff. The number of new pupils each year is about 200. Each year pupils are entered for GCE examinations at 'O' and 'A' level. Approximately 200 pupils are entered. There are 30 different buildings which have been built by the School. Pupils take part in over twenty different activities. The most successful sports teams are Basket Ball, Squash, Shooting and Tennis. There is no School Chapel and at present a new house is being built on the site and will be called Sennock House.
